_inspectorSnowReport.Report: This week has been stellarbut wait theres more! Summit Express is expected to open midday today. Dust off your powder skis and boards because Its going to be soft, steep, and deep up there. Summit Express spinning means Dynamite laps are back, so take a cruise and soak in the views. Theres still plenty of soft snow to be found in the trees in Apex Express and Moonbeam Express terrain. We are expecting temperatures in the low to mid-20s under mostly cloudy skies. Another storm will roll in today with scattered snowfall starting later this afternoon and evening. The forecasts are spread out, calling for 8 to 20 inches of snow, fingers crossed for another heavy hitter. We are as excited as you for freshies but dont duck ropes into closed terrain. Unseen hazards exist and you will lose your pass for at least 30 days (at all Ikon Pass resorts). Expert skills are required on Sunrise terrain. The easiest way down from Powderhorn II is to take Eagle Ridge to Sunshine Bowl. Beginners should stick to Link and Moonbeam Express.

_inspectorSnowReport.Alert: Know The Code, limit your speed, and stay in control while skiing and riding.
